title: Non salva la posta inviata
content: Ciao, da circa 4gg l'invio della posta è lento, ma soprattutto, quando riesce ad inviare poi non salva i messaggi in posta inviata; rimane aperta la mail con la finestra di invio in evidenza (come da screenshot allegato). Se provo a cliccare su annulla mi dice che il messaggio è stato inviato, ma non è stata salvata una copia: cliccando su riprova rimane solo il messaggio inviato senza che accada nulla (altro screenshot - ne ho sovrapposti due). Prima lo faceva ogni tanto, in questi giorni invece accade con tutti i messaggi. Inoltre, ogni tanto mi dice che il collegamento con il server è fuori tempo massimo, ma generalmente uso il telefono come hotspot e potrebbe essere questo il motivo? Grazie per l'aiuto Andrea p.s. considerate che non sono un gran esperto, quindi risposte semplici per favore :-)
creator: a.castiglione

title: [Beta] Unified Folders Inbox does not show all Inbox mail, nor all new/unread Inbox mail
content:
Using Thunderbird 112.0b7 on Windows 11, with three accounts (1 IMAP, 2 Google Mail) and Unified Folders enabled, the Unified Folders Inbox will only show a few new/unread mails, but not the older mail in the inboxes.

When I toggle the "Show only unread messages" quick filter on and off, the other mails appear, but the process is very slow and it insists on scrolling to the oldest mail (>10 years) instead of remaining with the newest or selected item.

When new mails arrive, they (and only them) mostly show up in the Unified Inbox, but it's unreliable. E.g. when I was changing some Firefox account settings earlier, the email notification for that only showed up in the account's Inbox, not the Unified Inbox, until I switched back and forth between the two.

Overall I quite like this latest Thunderbird beta and it's almost made me switch back to Thunderbird (from Mailbird [no relation] or Betterbird), but this bug(?) has made me miss messages and the general performance, while vastly improved vs the last time I used TB, is still sometimes severely lacking (and lagging).

title: Fresh install in order to access very old (Thunderbird 24) profiles
content: I have kept a PC at a relative's house for more years than I like to admit (mutually beneficial arrangement). The PC still exists and was originally running Windows 8. I would have migrated the email from Outlook Express, and I do recall this being successful. I have not accessed the email on the machine for about 9 years or more. Unfortunately, it is not simply a case of launching Thunderbird because the machine has since been upgraded to Windows 8.1. I have checked the disk and have found that the Windows installation program was nice enough to save the Thunderbird profiles in a backup directory. I believe the version of Thunderbird would have been 24.0.1. I still have the installation file (Thunderbird Setup 24.0.1.exe) but Windows 8.1 tells me it's corrupt so I can no longer install this version. Also, I fully expect the structure of the data files has changed since those days so I'm not sure I will be able to just install any version of Thunderbird, copy the profile directories, launch TB, and be successful in accessing the emails. Would someone be kind enough to put me on the right path here?
creator: SumoBot

title: missing calendar
content:
Hello, I have a similar problem as previously described in https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1387513 One calendar entirely fails to display. If I add an event to this calendar, it shows for a few seconds, then vanishes. It is a LOCAL calendar, so no problem with connecting with other servers. Other local or remote calendars are fine. NB: as this was mentioned to possibly give problems, yes, I have repeated events with weekly repetition. I don't remember having events "last day of the month" though.

Some tech infos below: Thunderbird Version 102.9.1 20230328155238 Canal de mise à jour release Darwin 17.7.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.7.0: Mon Aug 31 22:11:23 PDT 2020; root:xnu-4570.71.82.6~1/RELEASE_X86_64

Thanks a lot for maintaining this support, and otherwise great app.

title: Send accounts issues
content:
Hi Folks! I'm facing some annoying issues when I send, answer or forward a e-mail.

Well, let me explain:

I have a work e-mail redirected to a Gmail account, so ALL messages are redirected to Gmail inbox. When I use Gmail webmail, the default address to send, answer and forward messages is the work e-mail, so, I don't need worry about it... Always my messages are send using my work account!

BUT

When I use the Gmail account in Thunderbird, it ALWAYS use gmail to send messages. I already tryed delete the Gmail SMTP server and keep only the work SMTP server, but even that Thunderbird finds a way to send as Gmail. So, to send my messages by work e-mail, I need keep both accounts configured in Thunderbird (Gmail and work), and change the send account EVERY SINGLE TIME I send, answer or forward a message.

I could use some other program, as Microsoft Email, but I don't want it... I want continue using Thunderbird, but fixing this issue.

Any ideas?

Thanks.
creator: fabioabibi

title: Message Filters Being Deleted
content:
I have Thunderbird 102.9.0 (64-bit), running on Linux Mint 20.3 (Una). Thunderbird is losing rules in a message filter, and losing message filters. I have 6 filters, 5 active.

I'm getting unwanted emails from 99 email addresses. I created a message filter, "loanfrontends", and added some of the email addresses. As another came in, I would add it. (I'm tracking them in a spreadsheet.) I had 20 rules entered (to move messages containing any of the email addresses to Trash). Ran the filter manually, messages went to Trash. Over several days, more were moved to Trash.

Then they weren't. I checked and message filter loanfrontends had only 3 rules. The other 17 disappeared. Concerned that there may be some limit to the number of rules, or filters, or whatever, I created another message filter, "loanfrontends01". (By create, I mean copy loanfrontends, removing existing rules, and adding new ones) I added 4 rules. Manually ran to test, and the messages were moved to Trash.

A few days later, I noticed messages not being moved. Checking message filters, I note that loanfrontends01 is gone. I've created another message filter, added some addresses to it. And it also disappeared after a few days.

So... why are message filter rules and message filters disappearing?
creator: register110

title: How to setup sent folder
content:

title: Message Processing Issue - Downloading Stops, Messages Stay on Server
content:
I get the message: The account mbanish@zoomtown.com is being processed. Please wait until processing is complete to get messages.

And then Thunderbird stops loading messages. When I restart, it starts loading them again, but the same ones because it didn't finish and pull them off the server (POP3) the last time.

I have gone to the server at AltaFiber (Cincinnati Bell, my Internet Service Provider) and deleted messages that appear to be stopping the download, but that didn't help. It stopped again.

Please help. This has been going on for a few months now, and I keep having to get messages using Gmail and going directly to the Server. I need to know what's going on and fix this.

Mike Banish mbanish@zoomtown.com
creator: mbanish

title: Hide individual inboxes in unified view left pane
content:
Thunderbird updated itself to Version 112.0b7 and I've lost the ability to hide the individual email accounts in the left pane. I have the account Server Settings --> Message Storage --> Advanced set to store incoming mail in Local Folders. That's the option (When downloading mail from this account's server, use the following folder to store new messages:) This is set to -- Inbox for different account --> [Local Folders]

Previous versions hid all the other individual mailboxes that were stacked on top of the Local Folders. The update seems to have broken that ability. Is there another way to get rid of all those accounts above the Local Folders?
creator: ff80
